p: Considering that AGL14 induces LFY, it was not unexpected that the pattern of LFY expression was similar to that of AGL14 in chilled dormant buds (Fig. 7a). Levels of LFY transcripts were highest at week six, at which point dormancy is released, in both TBs and AXBs (Fig. 7a). In stark contrast, pre-dormancy low temperature significantly reduced AGL14 and LFY expression, relative to the expression in chilled dormant buds (Fig. 7c). In conclusion, the upregulation of FT1, AGL14 and LFY by low temperature occurs only in dormant buds.
